H0.text: Temperatures would increase as the most likely effect of a large decrease in the number of woodpeckers in a forest.

H1.text: Precipitation would increase as the most likely effect of a large decrease in the number of woodpeckers in a forest.

H2.text: The number of trees in the forest would increase as the most likely effect of a large decrease in the number of woodpeckers.

H3.text: The insect population in the forest would increase as a result of a large decrease in the number of woodpeckers.

A4.text: Most woodpecker species feed on insects and other invertebrates living under bark and in wood.
